reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This house has to have the perfect situation in Bude: along side and overlooking the canal with views of either a wonderful back garden of out over the sea. Paul and Mary are the perfect hosts and offer a quiet but superb facility which is their home - and you feel at home too! Three fantastic rooms all colour co-ordinated, to a high standard and very comfortable with all the facilities you would expect from a 4* hotel. The breakfasts are brilliant, always a choice and the cooked breakfast is the best. It is a base for a great holiday in Bude!
reviews.title: Excellent quality with superb hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner & I stayed at Breakwater House B&B for 5 days and our hosts Paul and Mary couldn't have been more welcoming. There are 3 rooms to select from: Red, Green or Blue. We stayed in the Blue Room which has a large en-suite shower and bathroom, and rear balcony overlooking the beautiful garden Mary tends. It also overlooks a local church and you are awoken by birdsong and church bells. The Blue Room was spacious, clean and every other day you are provided with fresh fluffy white towels. There are tea/coffee facilities, a fridge for fresh milk and a large plasma TV screen/DVD player. The lounge has a selection of up to date magazines, newspapers and DVD's to choose from. Breakfast is from 0800-0900 and your request is submitted the evening before for cooked food - additionally there are cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit and a selection of fresh juices. Breakwater House is situated right on Bude Canal so you are in an excellent spot to drive the coastal road to Widemouth Bay (try Elements restaurant for dinner - it has fantastic views), you are steps away from Summerleaze Beach with soft sand, rocks to clamber over or a spot of seaside dining at Life's a Beach, or to walk into Bude town which has a multitude of quaint gift and seaside style shops. The UK weather was extremely kind during our stay - not a spot of rain - so we also visited Tintagel Castle (10 miles approx) and Boscastle (7 miles approx) both worth a mention. Another tip - if you are visiting Padstow, drive to Rock, park your car and take the ferry there in 5 minutes - but arrive before the tide goes out or you'll be walking half a mile down the beach! We loved our week in beautiful Cornwall and Breakwater House was the perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

reviews.text: Just arrived back from a 2 night stay at Breakwater House. We stayed with our young daughter and 7 month old son which can be problematic but our hosts Paul & Mary were so thoughtful that it couldn't have been better. Our room (green) was fantastic, large with wonderful views over the canal and towards the beach. It was spotless and the small single bed for our daughter was lovely. The en-suite was a good size, immaculate with a wonderful shower.

reviews.text: It was our first weeks holiday in the UK for many years and our stay at Breakwater House was everything we could wish for. Paul and Mary's hosting skills where first class giving us excellent advise on where to eat out, coastal walks and places to visit within the surrounding area.
